content.statement: vascular:venous:ivc-001-filters is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:venous:ivc-001-filters helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:venous:ivc-001-filters include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:venous:ivc-001-filters.

permanent.use: When anticoagulation will never be possible

retrievable.description: Designed for removal when indication resolves
retrievable.examples: ALN, Cook Celect, Günther Tulip, Option, Denali
retrievable.retrieval_window: Ideally within 3-6 months; FDA recommends as soon as protection no longer needed
retrievable.note: Can become permanent if left in place

absolute: Acute DVT/PE with absolute contraindication to anticoagulation
DVT/PE with life-threatening complications of anticoagulation
relative: Massive PE with residual DVT (when anticoagulation risky)
High-risk trauma patients unable to anticoagulate
Planned pharmacomechanical thrombectomy (to catch dislodged emboli)
not_indicated: Primary VTE prophylaxis without proven DVT/PE
Alternative to anticoagulation when anticoagulation is possible

positioning.suprarenal: Above renal veins if thrombus extends to renal level, pregnancy (IVC compressed)
positioning.suprarenal_risks: Renal vein thrombosis if filter occludes

retrieval.timing: As soon as temporary indication resolves
retrieval.fda_recommendation: Within 29-54 days depending on filter type
retrieval.technique: Snare capture through jugular or femoral access

difficult_retrieval.causes: Tilt, embedding in wall, strut fracture
difficult_retrieval.advanced_techniques: Excimer laser, endobronchial forceps, covered stent

filter_related.ivc_penetration: Up to 95% asymptomatic on CT; rarely symptomatic
filter_related.strut_fracture: Can embolize to heart or lungs

presentation: Patient with DVT/PE who cannot anticoagulate
diagnosis: Rule out duplicated IVC or IVC thrombus
treatment: Place infrarenal IVC filter under image guidance
Document filter type, position, and planned retrieval date
Retrieve filter when no longer needed
Track all placed filters for retrieval follow-up

definition.@value: Intravascular devices placed in the inferior vena cava to prevent pulmonary embolism by trapping venous emboli migrating from the lower extremities or pelvis.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: List absolute and relative indications for IVC filter placement
Describe placement technique and proper positioning
Explain importance of timely filter retrieval
clinical_pearls: Absolute indication: DVT/PE with contraindication to anticoagulation
Filters do NOT prevent DVT - only prevent PE from reaching lungs
Retrievable filters should be retrieved when indication resolves (FDA: 29-54 days)
IVC penetration occurs in up to 95% but is usually asymptomatic
Position filter infrarenal (below lowest renal vein) unless specific indication for suprarenal

medicalCode.description: Inferior vena cava filter in situ
Insertion of intravascular vena cava filter
Retrieval of intravascular vena cava filter
Presence of other vascular implants and grafts
